def: An instrument for measuring the magnifying power of a lens orsystem of lenses.
A boat with a flat bottom and square ends; -- used for thetransportation of bulky freight, especially in shallow waters.
A sort of electroscope, invented by Rousseau, in which the drypile is employed to measure the amount of electricity transmitted bydifferent bodies, or to determine their conducting power. Nichol.
A catering; a buying of provisions. [Obs.] Bailey.
To place the profits of (ecclesiastical property) in the handsof a layman for care and disbursement.
A Chilian burrowing rodent of the genus Spalacopus.
A print made by photozincography.-- Pho`to*zin`co*graph"ic, a.
To give or dedicate in token of thanks. [Obs. or R.] Mede.
